Dear Tia Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title & (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Section policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was engaged in a physical altercation with another youth
and was assaultive towards the staff member who intervened to
break it up. The staff member put hands up to block the youth and
allegedly choked the youth. Video footage does not show the
youth being choked.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/14/24. Complainant did not have any further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/14/24. Youth A reported he and Youth B began arguing. Youth
A reported Staff 4 stopped them from physically fighting. Youth A
reported Staff 1 came out of nowhere and told him to chill out.
Youth A reported Youth B came after him again, and Staff 4
restrained Youth B to stop them from fighting. Youth A reported he
tried to kick the door, but accidently kicked Staff 1 instead. Youth
A reported Staff 1 was stopping him from going after Youth B.
Youth A reported he told Staff 1, “do not touch me”, he was so
upset, and he pushed Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 began
choking him until he couldn’t breathe. Youth A reported Staff 1
brought him into the hallway, kept choking him, and when Staff 1
released him, he fell to the ground. Youth A reported Staff 4 came
into the hallway and took him to see the nurse.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/14/24.
Staff 1 went to the pod when he heard a code called. Staff 1
reported Youth C was escalated when he entered the pod. Staff 1
reported he walked past Youth A, who was calm when he entered
the pod. Staff 1 reported Youth A tried to kick him when he walked
by, but he let it go. Staff 1 reported Youth A became escalated,
which made Youth C even more escalated, so Staff 1 wanted to
get Youth A off the pod. Staff 1 reported when he got close to
Youth A, Youth A tried to swing on him, but Staff 1 blocked Youth
A’s hits. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 escorted Youth A off the pod. Staff
1 reported he never tried to choke Youth A and did not put his
hands on Youth A inappropriately in any way.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 11/19/24. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was about to fight with another youth (couldn’t remember
who), so staff had to intervene. Staff 2 reported Youth A and the
other youth continued to escalate each other and were trying to
physically fight with each other. Staff 2 reported when Youth A
tries to physically fight other youth and staff try to stop him, Youth
A typically turns the aggression towards the staff and fight them
2

instead. Staff 2 reported that’s what happened in this situation as
well. Staff 2 reported he, Staff 1 and Staff 4 were trying to get
Youth A off the pod because of his aggression and because he
was provoking the other youth. Staff 2 reported Youth A was not
leaving the pod willingly. Staff 2 reported he, and Staff 4 used a 2
man hold to walk Youth A off the pod. Staff 2 admitted Staff 1 bear
hugged Youth A during the incident. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 never
choked Youth A or did anything similar. Staff 2 reported the bear
hug is not a trained method in MANDT; however, staff use it
frequently in the heat of the moment, especially if they are
handling an escalated situation with a youth by themselves.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 11/14/24.
Staff 3 reported a code was called to the pod, which means
everyone is required to report. Staff 3 reported when she entered
the pod, Youth A was right by the door. Youth A was aggressive
and yelling, so it was determined to be best to remove him from
the pod. Staff 3 reported Youth A was swinging at Staff 1 and Staff
1 had his arms up to block the hits. Staff 3 reported she, Staff 2,
and Staff 4 were present and were trying to get Youth A through
the door to remove him from the pod. Staff 3 reported Staff 1
never choked Youth A, or did anything similar to him, as his hands
were up the entire time defending himself against Youth A’s
attacks. Staff 3 reported she asked Youth A if he was okay and if
anything happened, and Youth A reported nothing happened.
Staff 3 reported Staff 4 escorted Youth A off the pod.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 12/27/24. Staff 4 reported
Youth A was acting up on the pod, so a code was called for
assistance. When Staff 4 entered the pod, Youth A was being
physically aggressive towards a peer (couldn’t remember who).
Staff 4 reported he and Staff 1 were trying to talk to Youth A to
calm him down and were trying to block Youth A from going after
the other youth. Staff 4 reported Youth A was trying to run through
them, kick the walls, etc. Staff 4 reported he and Staff 1 kept
blocking him, but they did not physically restrain him. Staff 4
reported they were just blocking Youth A so he was separated
from the rest of the group. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 bear hugged
Youth A from behind to try and help him calm down and provide a
“soft touch” to show Youth A he was there for him. Staff 4 reported
Staff 1 was not trying to manhandle Youth A or do it in a
controlling or aggressive way. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 never
choked Youth A during the incident.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/14/24. Administrator 1 watched the video with Consultant on
3

11/14/24. Administrator 1 confirmed the restraint hold Staff 1
completed on Youth A in the video is not the way restraints are
trained, and it does not follow the MANDT curriculum.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 11/9/24 was reviewed. The video does not
have any audio. Youth A is by the door and Staff 3 is in front of
him talking to him. Staff 2 comes over and is also talking with
them. Youth C gets up from the table and walks quickly over to
them. Staff 2 and Staff 3 block Youth C from getting to Youth A.
Staff 2 grabs Youth C’s wrist and is trying to pull him away from
Youth A, while Staff 3 is blocking Youth C from getting to Youth A
with her body. Staff 1 and Staff 4 enter the pod from the door
behind Youth A. Youth A tries to move around them from behind
but is stopped by Staff 4. Staff 4 puts his arms around Youth A’s
waist, lifts him and turns him around back towards the door. Youth
A tries to get around Staff 4 again and Staff 4 repeats the same
action, except this time Staff 4 continues to hold Youth A around
his waist and chest as Youth A is trying to get away. Youth A
crouches down, and moves around, so Staff 4 adjusts his arms so
one arm is over Youth A’s shoulder, one arm is around Youth A’s
waist, and he holds his hands together over Youth A’s chest. Staff
2 comes over and tries to help Staff 4 hold Youth A. Staff 4 moves
his arms, so he is bear-hugging Youth A from behind again. Staff
1 comes over and Youth A tries to kick him. Staff 1 holds Youth
A’s wrists/hands while Staff 4 is still bear-hugging him. Staff 2,
Staff 4 and Staff 1 are surrounding Youth A by the pod door. The
pod door is opened by another staff. Youth A tries to hit Staff 1.
Staff 1 puts his arm up towards Youth A, but the video is not clear
where his hand is on Youth A. Then Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 4, and
Youth A go out of the pod into the hallway.
The facility provided video from the hallway, but it did not include
footage from when Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 4 and Youth A go into the
hallway from the pod. It is footage from after the incident occurred.
The facility only keeps footage for 30 days and no longer has the
footage from the incident date in question.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report #170 “Resident Assault on Staff” dated
11/9/24 authored by Staff 3 notes Youth A and Youth C got
into a verbal altercation. Staff 3 attempted to verbally de-
escalate the situation but was unsuccessful. A code red
was called, so Staff 1 and Staff 4 responded. Staff 2
escorted Youth C away to prevent a physical altercation.
Youth A was still upset and attempting to assault Youth C.
4

Staff 4 placed Youth A in a two-arm hold while Youth A
continued to fight to get to Youth C. Staff 3 instructed Staff
1 and Staff 4 to remove Youth A from the pod. Youth A
began kicking Staff 1, hitting him in the private area, and
attempted to punch him in the face. Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Staff 4 removed Youth A from the pod.
• Incident report #171 “Alleged Child Abuse” dated 11/9/24
authored by Administrator 2. Administrator 2 arrived on the
scene where Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 4 were standing
around Youth A. Youth A reported Staff 1 choked him.
Administrator 2 asked Staff 1 to leave the scene, and then
escorted Youth A to the medical area to be examined by
the nurse.
• Medical assessment/progress note dated 11/9/24 regarding
Staff 1. No acute distress, pain, dizziness, fainting, trouble
swallowing, redness, bruising, injuries, cuts, or other
concerns noted. Youth A reported having a sore throat and
a cough for 2 days and was prescribed medicine. Youth A
reported Staff 1 choked him during an attempted peer
assault. Youth A reported Staff 1 choked him in the
hallway, and he couldn’t breathe. Youth A reported Staff 4
was present during the incident.
• Behavior Management Policy states only approved safe
physical management techniques may be used.
• Staff 1 has two disciplinary records in his employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 completed MANDT
physical skills training on 8/22/24.
• Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Staff 2 completed MANDT physical skills
training on 9/12/24.
• Staff 4 has two disciplinary records in his employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 4 completed MANDT
physical skills training on 9/12/24.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Staff 4 all stated Staff 1 did not choke Youth A. Youth A was
assessed by medical staff directly after the incident and noted
Youth A did not have any redness, bruising, injuries or concerns
noted. The video footage reviewed did not show Staff 1 choking
Youth A.
5

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Title & prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not restrain a youth properly.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 11/19/24. Staff 2 admitted
Staff 1 bear hugged Youth A during the incident. Staff 2 reported
the bear hug is not a trained method in MANDT; however, staff
use it frequently in the heat of the moment, especially if they are
handling an escalated situation with a youth by themselves.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 12/27/24. Staff 4 reported
Staff 1 bear hugged Youth A from behind to try and help him calm
down and provide a “soft touch” to show Youth A he was there for
him. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 was not trying to manhandle Youth A
or do it in a controlling or aggressive way.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
The video reviewed from 11/9/24 shows Staff 4 bear hugging
Youth A and restricting his movements, which is not an approved
MANDT restraint.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• MANDT physical skills manual does not show a bear hug
from behind as an acceptable restraint method. The
manual shows a one-person side body hold is acceptable.
• Behavior Management Policy states only approved safe
physical management techniques may be used.
• Staff 4 has two disciplinary records in his employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 4 completed MANDT
physical skills training on 9/12/24.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, video reviewed, and documentation reviewed Staff 4
6

inappropriately restrained Youth A by bear hugging him, which is
not an approved restraint method.
Technical Assistance
Technical assistance was offered for the facility to consider
updating their policy to add bear hugging on the list of prohibited
practices for restraint as Staff 2 reported bear hugging is
something staff do regularly, especially in the heat of the moment
when they’re by themselves.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2024C0000897SI dated 11/30/23; CAP approved 2/21/24
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Title & debriefing; reporting
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Facility did not complete a restraint incident report for a restraint
completed on 11/9/24.
Investigation VIDEO REVIEWED:
The video reviewed from 11/9/24 shows Staff 4 bear hugging
Youth A to restrict his movements, which, by definition, is
considered a restraint.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• There was no restraint incident report on file at the facility
or in MISACWIS.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per video reviewed and
documentation reviewed, Staff 4 restrained Youth A and a
restraint report was not completed.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR# 2025SIC0000004 dated 12/17/24; CAP pending
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
